test_1_coverage_ratio.interpretation: Total protection $5.175B covers only 35% of $14.82B probability-weighted expected loss. However, this is intentional structure - earnouts provide contingent protection tied to actual outcomes rather than upfront escrow.

test_3_time_horizon_match.recommendation: Escrow adequate for immediate risks only. Multi-year/perpetual exposures require R&W insurance (6-year tail) + earnouts (3-year performance-based) + fundamental business risk allocation to buyer. Time horizon mismatch is acceptable given hybrid structure intentionally shifts long-term operational risks to buyer as strategic acquirer.

minimum_escrow_thresholds_analysis.variance_explanation: T10 hybrid structure intentionally uses lower upfront escrow ($500M) supplemented by R&W insurance ($1.75B) + earnouts ($2.925B) = $5.175B total. This provides seller immediate liquidity while protecting buyer through insurance (unknown risks) + earnouts (performance-based adjustments). Structure is $1.125B below calculated minimum but justified by: (1) coal decline is business risk not escrow-able, (2) deferred capex is disclosed and buyer-assumed, (3) earnouts provide contingent protection up to actual losses.

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on: (1) statutory/regulatory certainty, (2) industry precedent/settlement rates, (3) expert judgment for novel risks, (4) Monte Carlo correlation modeling for portfolio effects

quantification_methodology.discount_rate_rationale: 8% WACC per T10 financial analyst based on: (1) PE-backed acquisition with 70% debt/30% equity assumed capital structure, (2) debt cost 6.5% (SOFR+325bps), (3) equity cost 12-15% for Class I railroad, (4) blended WACC ~8%
quantification_methodology.time_horizon: 5-year NPV for discrete events; perpetuity valuation for ongoing costs using 8% discount rate
quantification_methodology.scenario_modeling: T10 Monte Carlo simulation 10,000 iterations with correlation matrix for: (1) Base Case 60%, (2) Downside 30%, (3) Severe Downside 10%
quantification_methodology.range_handling: For exposure ranges (e.g., $45M-$89M), used: (1) P10 = low + 10% of range, (2) P50 = midpoint, (3) P90 = low + 90% of range for distribution modeling
quantification_methodology.double_counting_prevention: Correlation adjustments applied per T10 Monte Carlo modeling - see correlation_adjustments section for detailed methodology
